alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Teller and west central El Paso Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Pikes Peak to Colorado Springs. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Manitou Springs, Cimarron Hills and Cascade. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
